releases.details: Released as Doctor Who: Colony in Space (UK)
Released as the only separate release in the US

notes: The story serves as a commentary on the struggle between settlers and indigenous populations.
It marks the first color off-earth story recorded for Doctor Who.
This is the first appearance of Jo Grant in an off-Earth setting.

in_universe_mythology: The Master seeks to exploit the Doomsday Weapon for power.
real_world_cultural_references: The struggle for land and resources recalls historical conflicts between European settlers and Native Americans.

continuity_notes: This is the first time the TARDIS has traveled to another planet since the Doctor's exile began.

plot.plot_summary: The Time Lords send the Doctor to Uxarieus to confront the Master, who has stolen a file on a powerful weapon. The Doctor and his companion Jo find themselves in a conflict between colonists and an Interplanetary Mining Corporation.
The Doctor shows Jo the TARDIS for the first time, and they arrive on Uxarieus, where an agrarian clash against mining interests unfolds.
The tensions escalate further as they discover the real nature of the threats facing the colonists while they seek to save the crops and reclaim the land.
As the Doctor learns of the true motives of the IMC and the Master, Jo becomes embroiled in a dangerous plan to expose their operations.
The IMC engages in underhanded tactics, leading to a violent confrontation that threatens the colonists' survival and escalates with each passing episode.
Ultimately, the Doctor confronts the Master, the colonists rise against the IMC, and they must all face the consequences of their actions as Uxarieus teeters on the brink of all-out turmoil.
